go_data.justification: AMPK is described as a protein kinase activated by 5'adenosine monophosphate.
AMPK has an important role in skeletal muscle metabolism and protein synthesis and is able to inhibit the anabolic processes that consume ATP and regulate skeletal muscle mass.
AICA riboside increases AMP-activated protein kinase, fatty acid oxidation, and glucose uptake in rat muscle.
AICA riboside increases AMP-activated protein kinase, fatty acid oxidation, and glucose uptake in rat muscle.
The inhibition of protein synthesis by AMPK is mediated by the mTORC1 block.

Denervation-induced atrophy is related to the upregulation of specific histone deacetylases (HDAC), able to repress a negative regulator of myogenin, with an increase in MuRF1 expression and muscle wasting. AMPK (protein kinase activated by 5'adenosine monophosphate) is also involved in muscle atrophy.
